intro: Elytranthe torulosa, commonly known as the cushion plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to South America. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in umbels, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Elytranthe torulosa is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species often found in alpine regions.
